channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.description:

item.title: Report X-2023120299
item.description:
Report X-2023120299

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was taken to the Hazmat area and QA was informed to address the package. DescribePack: The top was loose on the bottle and there was no seal on the bottle to prevent any spillage. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The package was load right side up to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report I-2023110012
item.description:
Report I-2023110012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T00:32:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Southwest Airlines F7848 was taxing to take off when a passengers battery power bank was smoking. The flight attendant placed the device in the on-board fire containment bag and ARFF was dispatched to the aircraft. They have detained the aircraft until they can retrieve and check the device contained in the fire containment bag.
